abstractText: A 17th-18th century manuscript of the Ratnamālāvadāna, a collection of avadānas belonging to the cycle of king Aśoka and the monk Upagupta. The title given in the manuscript is Avadānaratnamālā (see the running marginal title under Marginalia). On the inside of the front cover, a note written in Nepālākṣarā bears the date 903 in Nepāla Saṃvat, corresponding to 1783 CE. This date does not necessarily refer to the writing date of the manuscript, it might have been added by one of the owners, a certain Jayendraka (śrī jayendrakasyedaṃ pu[sta]kaṃ saṃvat 903). This manuscript has not been used by Takahata for his editio princeps.
